thread.title: Sinn Féin agent's car set on fire in petrol bomb attack - BBC News
thread.title_full: Sinn Féin agent's car set on fire in petrol bomb attack - BBC News

title: Sinn Féin agent's car set on fire in petrol bomb attack - BBC News
text:
Sinn Féin agent's car set on fire in petrol bomb attack 21 February 2017 Read more about sharing. Close share panel A Sinn Féin election agent's car has been set on fire during a petrol bomb attack in Bangor, County Down. 
Police received a report of a black Citroen C4 Picasso on fire at Towerview Crescent at 22:30 GMT on Monday. 
The vehicle's window was smashed and a petrol bomb was thrown inside. Two masked men were seen in the area at the time. 
Police say they are treating the incident as a hate crime. 
Sinn Féin's leader in Northern Ireland, Michelle O'Neill, has condemned the attack. 
"This is an attack on the democratic process but it will not deter the local candidate or anyone else in Sinn Féin," she said. 
"There are clearly those who are intent on turning this into a brutal campaign and sectarianising the election." Related Topics
